channel.title: Posts on Fan's Home
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Fan's Home

item.title: Basic data structures - Array
item.description: 189. Rotate Array class Solution: def rotate(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> None: """ Do not return anything, modify nums in-place instead. """ k %= len(nums) nums[:] = nums[::-1] nums[:k] = nums[:k][::-1] nums[k:] = nums[k:][::-1] The simplest way is rotate nums three times. Python support rotate directly, but Java do not have corresponding function.

item.title: Nodejs l10n
item.description: Recently, our team started to do localization(l10n). The package we are using in the front end is ‘i18next’, an internationalization-framework written in and for JavaScript. I decided to use it in the backend because of its applicability. Quick start of i18next 1.Load the language resource from git submodule “cover” and “page” represent objects load from json files in submodule. // English resources const en = { cover, page, }; 2.Init i18next

item.title: Spring Framework Tutorials(1)
item.description: What is Dependency Injection? loose coupling (tight coupling) is means one object is not totally depend upon another object. Spring container/IoC container can Creating objects and then injecting them to your class. In spring, Ioc container is responsible to inject the dependencies, we provide meta-data to it by XML or annotation. For example, they are getting connected: class Laptop{ @Autowired HardDrive obj1; } @Component class HitachHD implements HardDrive{ ...... } you just need to implement dependency injection so that you can test and maintain better.
